caption.title: The results of pairwise invasibility analysis.
caption.p:
(a) An example of pairwise invasibility plot with x
C = 0.5, p
CC = 0.3, α = 1, β
G = β
L = 10. The black region shows that a mutant strain can invade a resident population. (b)-(d) The parameter dependence of evolutionarily stable proportion of global infection. The parameters except denoted below are the same as (a). (b) Dependence on recovery rate α. The red line denotes the evolutionarily stable (ESS) proportion of global infection G for p
CC = 0.25, the green line denotes that for p
CC = 0.35, and the blue line denotes that for p
CC = 0.4. (c) Dependence of ESS G on the degree of clustering

C = 0.7. (d) Dependence of ESS G on the degree of clustering, which is changed as in (b). The red line denotes results for β
G = β
L = 10, the green line for β

L = 8, and the blue line for β
G = 8, β
L = 10. (e) The red line denotes the ESS G and the green line denotes G values that maximize R 0.
